parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "SLURM",
"software": [
"openmpi/4.1.6--gcc--12.2.0",
"openblas/0.3.24--gcc--12.2.0",
"gcc/12.2.0",
"cuda/12.1",
"3dlaplacian"
],
"resources": [
"gpu:4",
"nodes:1",
"ntasks:4",
"ntasks-per-node:4",
"partition:boost_usr_prod",
"time:01:00:00",
"job-name:anisopb"
],
"environment": [
"LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/leonardo/home/userexternal/pdambra0/polynomialsmoothers/install/lib",
"SLURM_EXPORT_ENV=NONE"
],
"other": [
"degiter=8",
"idim=288",
"psize=4"
]
}
``` 
This script uses the SLURM workload manager to run the 3dlaplacian application. The script uses several software modules including openmpi, openblas, gcc, and cuda. It requests 4 GPUs, 1 node, 4 tasks, and 4 tasks per node. The script runs for 1 hour and has a job name of anisopb. The script sets the environment variable LD_LIBRARY_PATH and unsets SLURM_EXPORT_ENV. It defines several variables that are used in the script including degiter, idim, and psize.
